name: Test Ranged Retrieval of Attribute Values

customFields.Priority P1 to P4: P4 - Low-Impact (Edge or unsuitable to repeat?)

inline.description:
Test Ranged Retrieval of Attribute Values
————————————————————————————
Ensure Active Directory is setup for this testcase and shared by the Development Team (preferably Martin Kraft). The MaxRangeVal should be configured in the Active Directory instance

  1. Load AD/LDAP page in system console, with all the settings filled in.
  2. At the bottom of the page, click "AD/LDAP Test"
inline.expectedResult: • Confirmation message saying the connection is successful.

customFields.Related ticket(s): (Story) Add support for ranged retrieval of attribute values — MM-19743

inline.description:
1. Ensure LDAP Group Sync is enabled and configured and mapped to Teams.
  2. Login as an existing LDAP user and check if login works fine and they have access to the existing teams/channels.
inline.expectedResult: • Existing LDAP user should be able to login successfully and they should have access to correct teams/channels.

inline.description: 1. Login as a new LDAP user and check if login works fine and they are assigned to the Team automatically based on the LDAP Group sync rule.
inline.expectedResult: • New LDAP user should be able to login successfully and they should have access to correct teams/channels.

inline.description: 1. On System Console AD/LDAP Page, click AD/LDAP Synchronize now button.
inline.expectedResult: • AD/LDAP Synchronization should work fine and should be successful.

inline.description: 1. Check if users have access to the same teams/channels even after synchronization
inline.expectedResult: • All existing users should continue to have access to the same teams/channels even after synchronization.
